content: textured facecloth by tina s allsorts designs use your favourite cotton yarn and hook to work a textured facecloth the simple stitches make a tight weave with a bumpy exfoliating surface materials size 100g cotton dk yarn in any brand 10 square or any size you like 4mm hook uk terms us terms in brackets method make a foundation chain with an odd number of stitches plus one in the sample shown i made 41 + 1 chain this made an 8 square and i added a 1 border ch1 & turn at the end of every row o row 1 working into the back bumps of the foundation chain slip st in the 2nd st from the hook * treble_crochet double_crochet in the next st slip_stitch in next st * repeat from * to * to end of row ch1 & turn this is a set up row o row 2 * slip_stitch into next treble_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet into same st * repeat from * to * to end of row and slip_stitch into the turning chain ch1 & turn take care not to miss the slip_stitch into the turning chain or you will lose a st on every row see fig 1 2 & 3 repeat row 2 until your facecloth is square or the length you want now add a border to neaten the edges work the side edge first without turning make a loose chain & half_double_crochet half_double_crochet into the base of the same st not the next one work a row of half_double_crochet s half_double_crochet along the side edge making one stitch per row work half_double_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet into the corner then work along the bottom edge working a half_double_crochet half_double_crochet into each st work the next corner as before then work the second side edge to match the first work the 3rd corner then one half_double_crochet half_double_crochet into each treble_crochet double_crochet and slip_stitch along the top edge for the final corner work half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ch2 then slip_stitch into the half_double_crochet half_double_crochet at the start of the border you can fasten_off now and stitch your ends in or continue with the border as follows make a loose chain & turn then slip_stitch into the corner space make a loose chain & half_double_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet into the corner space work a half_double_crochet half_double_crochet into every st and work the corners as before if you wish turn and add a row of treble_crochet s double_crochet s next but working ch3 in each corner cut the yarn and weave in all ends neatly secure them well to withstand your facecloth being wrung out 100g of yarn is enough for one 10 facecloth and a set of four 4 square matching scrubbies fig 1 slip_stitch into the next treble_crochet fig 2 treble_crochet into the same st us
